The statue of Christ in Rio de Janeiro is the famous symbol of Brazil.
Having this monument constructed, a country celebrated a century of independence.
The world's largest sculpture in the Art Deco style is one of the new wonders of the world.
Elements of this colossal statue were made in France...
...and shipped to Brazil carefully by sea.
The statue can be seen from anywhere in the city.
Christ the Redeemer spreads out his hands in a gesture of blessing and protection...
...and from the pedestal, you can see a stunningly great view of Rio de Janeiro and the Atlantic Ocean.
